Detailed Description

Class to handle drawing of a given pulse.

See also:
https://github.com/alcap-org/AlcapDAQ/wiki/rootana_module_ExportPulses

00084         else if( event_pulse_request.inside=="")error_type="pulse";

00086         else if( !ParsePulseRequest(event_pulse_request.inside,pulse_list)) error_type="pulse";
00087         if(error_type != ""){
00088           cout<<"Skipping badly formatted "<<error_type<<" specification: "<<*i_request<<endl;
00089           cout<<"event="<<event_pulse_request.before<<", pulse="<<event_pulse_request.inside<<endl;
00090           ShowGuidance();
00091           continue;
00092         }
00093         // Everything is ok so add this request to the list
00094         for(std::vector<EventID_t>::const_iterator i_event=event_list.begin();
00095             i_event!=event_list.end();
00096             i_event++){
00097           for(std::vector<TPulseIslandID>::const_iterator i_pulse=pulse_list.begin();

00100           }
00101         }
00102       }
00103     }
00104   }
00105   return 0;

ExportPulse * ExportPulse::Instance (  )  [inline, static]

Static method to get the instance of ExportPulse.

Warning:
This method returns NULL if the ExportPulse module is not requested by the user through the modules file. Always check the returned pointer is not NULL before using it: 
 if(ExportPulse::Instance()){
    // now we know it's safe, you can do something with this module
     ExportPulse::Instance()->AddToExportList(channel,0);
 }
Returns:
NULL if the module was not requested in the modules file

int ExportPulse::ProcessEntry ( TGlobalData *  gData,
const TSetupData *  gSetup 
) [private, virtual]

Plot all pulses that we were asked to draw for this event.

First loads pulses requested by the config file, then draws all TPIs, then draw all TAPs.

Implements BaseModule.

int BaseModule::ProcessGenericEntry ( TGlobalData *  gData,
const TSetupData *  gSetup 
) [inherited]

Method called by the main event loop for each entry in the input root tree. Does some simple work, then hooks into the derived class through ProcessEntry.

Returns:
0 on sucess and non-zero if a problem occurred

TDirectory* BaseModule::dir [protected, inherited]

Many modules use 'dir' still which was the old protected pointer to the modules directory. To prevent things being broken so soon, we keep this pointer available, but be warned that it will be removed shortly...
